trial_identification.studytitle: A three month randomised, prospective , single-blind controlled study to determine the effect of two dairy lipid preparations on bone and calcium metabolism in normal post-menopausal women.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Effect of Dairy Lipids on Bone Metabolism in Normal Post-Menopausal Women

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Normal metabolism and endocrine development and function

interventions.interventions: 10 grams/day of one of two dairy lipid preparations containing stearic acid/12 weeks. Product A has 15 % stearic acid as a percentage of all fatty acids and product B has 10 % stearic acid as a percentage of all fatty acids.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Serum markers of bone turnover - Serum total alkaline phosphatase, osteocalcin, P1NP and C-telopeptide.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Urine markers of bone turnover - N-telopeptide and deoxypyridinoline
Bone mineral density in lumbar spine, proximal femur and total body on Lunar Prodigy Densitometer

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Healthy women at least 5 years post -menopause
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Osteoporosis (Bone Mineral Density(BMD) T score <2.5 at hip or spine) concurrent major systemic illness renal impairment chronic liver disease active major gastrointestinal disease metabolic bone diease use of glucocorticoids in preceding 12 mths use of bisphosphonates or Hormone Replacement Therapy (HRT) or other medications known to cause osteoporosis or interfere with bone metabolism.

trial_design.concealment: Eligible .participants will be allocated to one of three groups, normal diet, or one of two preparations of dairy lipids. Allocation is concealed by the use of numbered containers.
trial_design.sequence: Randomisation will be undertaken using a variable block size schedule, based on computer generated random numbers.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This research study aims to find out whether new preparations of dairy lipids, like butters, have any effectson bone metabolism that might help revent osteoporosis.
